description: A utility for reviewing textbook problems, and tracking progress in textbooks.

arguments.help: Add a new problem set to this group in the format chapter.section:problems.  For example, 2.1.39 would be section 1 of chapter 2, with 39 problems.
The problem gotten correct in the format 'chapter.section:problem'.  For example, '6.5:15' would be problem 15 from section 5 of chapter 6.  When a problem is marked correct, automatically saves.
When generating random problems, only generate even problems.
Edit a set of problems.  Takes the old problem set and the new problem set.
The filename for the book being reviewed.
Load from human readable format. (Will not load file history
Save in a human readable format. (Will not save file history.
The problem gotten incorrect in the format chapter.section:problem.  For example, 6.5:15 would be problem 15 from section 5 of chapter 6.  When a problem is marked incorrect, automatically saves.
Print all of the current problem sets.
When generating random problems, only generate odd problems.
Print the list of problem sets.
Force save without marking any correct or incorrect.
Set the default file to work on.
Display review statistics on the given file.
Adds a timestamp to the filename. (Note: the file name must include some extension, e.g.: .txt)
